com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic

Class Disjunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.ExpressionObject
      • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.BooleanExpression
        • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.NAryBooleanExpression
          • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.Disjunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, Formula, java.lang.Comparable<Formula>

    public class Disjunction
extends NAryBooleanExpression
    A disjunction is a Boolean expression that is true when any of its disjuncts are true.
    Author:
    Stephen G. Ware

      • unify

        public Bindings unify(Formula other,
                      Bindings bindings)
        Description copied from interface: Formula
        Unifies this logical formula with another by adding constraints to a given set of bindings.
        Parameters:
        other - the formula to be unified with this one
        bindings - the bindings to which constraints will be added
        Returns:
        a new set of bindings with constraints added if the formulas can be unified, null if they cannot be unified

      • isImposable

        public boolean isImposable()
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Returns true if this expression can be imposed (i.e. can be in the initial state or can be an effect). An expression must be deterministic to be impossible.
        Returns:
        true if the formula can be imposed, false otherwise
